sen.j: 趙陶斎（ちょう とうさい、正徳 (日本)3年（1713年） - 天明6年4月20日 (旧暦)（1786年5月17日））は、江戸時代中期の書家である。
sen.e: Tosai CHO (1713 - May 17, 1786) was a calligrapher in the mid Edo period.
Tosai CHO (1713 - May 17, 1786) was a calligrapher during the mid Edo period.
Tosai CHO (1713 - May 17, 1786) was a calligrapher during the mid Edo period.

sen.j: 名前は養、字を仲頤、号 (称号)は陶斎、他に息心居士、枸杞園、清嘩閣等がある。
sen.e: His given name was Yo with his surname being CHUI having a title (appletive) of Tosai and was also known as Sokushinkoji, Kukeon and Seikakaku.
His given name was Yo with his surname being CHUI having a title (appletive) of Tosai and was also known as Sokushinkoji, Kukeon, and Seikakaku.
His given name was Yo with his surname being CHUI having a title (appellative) of Tosai and was also known as Sokushinkoji, Kukeon, and Seikakaku.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 長崎生まれ。
sen.e: He was born in Nagasaki Prefecture.
He was born in Nagasaki Prefecture.
He was born in Nagasaki Prefecture.

sen.j: 趙淞陽という清国南京市の来舶商人が丸山 (長崎市)に遊び、陶斎はこの中国人と花魁との間に生まれた。
sen.e: Shoyo CHO, a Chinese merchant from Nanjin City, Qing visited a brothel in Maruyama (a redlight district in Nagasaki City) and Tosai was born of a courtesan by that Chinese man and a courtesan.
Shoyo CHO, a Chinese merchant from Nanjin City, Qing visited a brothel in Maruyama (a redlight district in Nagasaki City) and Tosai was born of a courtesan by that Chinese man and a courtesan.
Shoyo CHO, a Chinese merchant from Nanjin City, Qing visited a brothel in Maruyama (a redlight district in Nagasaki City) and Tosai was born between that Chinese man and a courtesan.
sen.cmt: of a courtesanは削除しました。

sen.j: 趙子昂の末裔ともいわれる。
sen.e: It is said that Tosai was a descendant of Shiko CHO.
It is said that Tosai was a descendant of Shiko CHO.
It is said that Tosai was a descendant of Shiko CHO.

sen.j: 幼くして孤児となり不遇な生い立ちでは会ったが、清の帰化僧竺庵浄印が長崎の興福寺 (長崎市)に来たとき、竺庵に目をかけられこれに入門。
sen.e: Being orphaned at very young age, Tosai had unhappy upbringing but, during the visit of Jikuan Join, the naturalized priest from Qing, to Kofuku-ji Temple in Nagasaki (Nagasaki City), Jukuan Join took a kindly interest in Tosai whereby Tosai became his disciple.

Being orphaned at very young age, Tosai had unhappy upbringing but, during the visit of Jikuan Join, the naturalized priest from Qing, to Kofuku-ji Temple in Nagasaki (Nagasaki City), Jukuan Join took a kindly interest in Tosai whereby Tosai became his disciple.

Being orphaned at very young age, Tosai had unhappy upbringing but, during the visit of Jikuan Join, the naturalized priest from Qing, to Kofuku-ji Temple in Nagasaki (Nagasaki City), Jikuan Join took a kindly interest in Tosai whereby Tosai became his disciple.

sen.j: 11歳で僧となる。
sen.e: He became a priest at age 11.
He became a priest at age 11.
He became a priest at age 11.

sen.j: 享保19年（1734年）に竺庵が黄檗宗本山である宇治市萬福寺の堂頭になったため、一緒に京都に上る。
sen.e: In 1734, as Jikuan became the resident priest of Manpuku-ji Temple, the Head Temple of Obaku-sect, Tosai went to Kyoto with Jikuan.
In 1734, as Jikuan became the resident priest of Manpuku-ji Temple, the Head Temple of Obaku-sect, Tosai went to Kyoto with Jikuan.
In 1734, as Jikuan became the resident priest of Manpuku-ji Temple in Uji, the Head Temple of Obaku sect, Tosai went to Kyoto with Jikuan.

sen.j: 28歳までの18年間僧籍にあったが、元文5年頃になんらかの事情で還俗して儒者となった。
sen.e: Tosai remained in priesthood for 18 years until he was 28 years of age but, around 1740, he returned to secular life for some reason and became a Confucian.
Tosai remained in the priesthood for 18 years until he was 28 years of age but, around 1740, he returned to secular life for some reason and became a Confucian.
Tosai remained in the priesthood for 18 years until he was 28 years of age but, around 1740, he returned to secular life for some reason and became a Confucian.

sen.j: 諸国を遊歴すること、東西南北58ヶ国に及んだという。
sen.e: It is said that Tosai visited as many as 58 provinces throughout Japan.
It is said that Tosai visited as many as 58 provinces throughout Japan.
It is said that Tosai visited as many as 58 provinces throughout Japan.

sen.j: 32歳頃に江戸に出て麻布などに住んで十数年を過ごした後、46歳頃に大坂の中国通詞深見久兵衛方に身を寄せる。
sen.e: When he was around 32 years of age, Tosai went to Edo where he spent a dozen years living at various location locations including Azabu but, subsequently at about 46 years of age, he lived with a Chinese interpreter Kuhei FUKAMI in Osaka.

When he was around 32 years of age, Tosai went to Edo where he spent a dozen years living at various locations including Azabu but, subsequently at about 46 years of age, he lived with a Chinese interpreter Kuhei FUKAMI in Osaka.

When he was around 32 years of age, Tosai went to Edo where he spent a dozen years living at various locations including Azabu but, subsequently at about 46 years of age, he lived with a Chinese interpreter Kuhei FUKAMI in Osaka.

sen.j: 塩町に住み妻帯し一時期、内田氏（妻側の氏と推定）を名乗る。
sen.e: Tosai lived in Shio-cho with his wife, going by a surname of UCHIDA (presumably the surname of his wife's family) for a period of time.
Tosai lived in Shio-cho with his wife, going by a surname of UCHIDA (presumably the surname of his wife's family) for a period of time.
Tosai lived in Shio-cho with his wife, going by a surname of UCHIDA (presumably the surname of his wife's family) for a period of time.

sen.j: 58歳頃に堺市に移り益田孟文というパトロンの別邸に起居し、売薬などをして生計を立てている。
sen.e: Tosai moved to Sakai City at about 58 years of age and lived at the villa of his patron by the name of 益田孟文, earning his living by selling medicine.
Tosai moved to Sakai City at about 58 years of age and lived at the villa of his patron by the name of 益田孟文, earning his living by selling medicine.
Tosai moved to Sakai City at about 58 years of age and lived at the villa of his patron by the name of Osafumi MASUDA (益田孟文), earning his living by selling medicine.
sen.cmt: Osafumi MASUDAと追加し、漢字名も残しました。

sen.j: このとき裏庭に枸杞を植え枸杞園と称しており、その実を丸薬として調合し生計の足しとしていた。
sen.e: During this time, Tosai planted wolfberries in the backyard which was called Kukoen (the wolfberry garden) and prepared pills with wolfberries to supplement his income.
During this time, Tosai planted wolfberries in the backyard which was called Kukoen (the wolfberry garden) and prepared pills with wolfberries to supplement his income.
During this time, Tosai planted wolfberries in the backyard which was called Kukoen (the wolfberry garden) and prepared pills with wolfberries to supplement his income.

sen.j: 65歳のときに娘を授かっている。
sen.e: A daughter was born when he was 65.
A daughter was born when he was 65.
A daughter was born when he was 65.

sen.j: 70歳を祝して福家という料亭で盛大な賀宴が催されている。
sen.e: To celebrate his 70th birthday, a lavish banquet was given for Tosai at a Japanese-style restaurant known as Fukuya.
To celebrate his 70th birthday, a lavish banquet was given for Tosai at a Japanese-style restaurant known as Fukuya.
To celebrate his 70th birthday, a lavish banquet was given for Tosai at a Japanese-style restaurant known as Fukuya.

sen.j: 享年74。
sen.e: His age at death is 74.
His age at death was 74.
His age at death was 74.

sen.j: 増山雪斎が儒官十時梅厓を堺に派遣して葬儀を取り仕切った。
sen.e: Sessai MASHIYAMA made an arrangement for Tosai's funeral by sending the Confucian scholar Baigai TOTOKI to Sakai.
Sessai MASHIYAMA made an arrangement for Tosai's funeral by sending the Confucian scholar Baigai TOTOKI to Sakai.
Sessai MASHIYAMA made an arrangement for Tosai's funeral by sending the Confucian scholar Baigai TOTOKI to Sakai.

sen.j: 南宗寺本源院に葬られる。
sen.e: Was buried at the Hongenin burial grounds of Nanshu-ji Temple.
Was buried at the Hongenin burial grounds of Nanshu-ji Temple.
He was buried at the Hongenin burial grounds of Nanshu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 書
sen.e: Calligraphy
Calligraphy
Calligraphy

sen.j: 陶斎は書画、篆刻に優れた。
sen.e: Tosai excelled in calligraphy, paintings and a Tenkoku (carving using a special chinese character, Tensho).
Tosai excelled in calligraphy, paintings and a Tenkoku (carving using the special Chinese character, Tensho).
Tosai excelled in calligraphy, paintings and a Tenkoku (carving using the special Chinese character, Tensho).

sen.j: はじめ禅僧 竺庵より唐風の書法を習い、やがて文徴明や趙孟頫に私淑し、晩年は米芾に傾倒した。
sen.e: Tosai originally learned the Tang-style calligraphy from the Zen monk Jikuan but, before long becoming strongly influenced by Chomei BUN and Mofu CHO and, in his old age, was devoted to Beihutsu.
Tosai originally learned the Tang-style calligraphy from the Zen monk Jikuan but, before long becoming strongly influenced by Chomei BUN and Mofu CHO and, in his old age, was devoted to Beihutsu.
Tosai originally learned the Tang-style calligraphy from the Zen monk Jikuan but, before long became strongly influenced by Chomei BUN and Mofu CHO and, in his old age, was devoted to Futsu BEI.

sen.j: 先哲の書法を学ぶため、書帖や墨跡を集め臨模に努めた。
sen.e: To study the art of calligraphy of philosophers of the past, Tosai collected their notes and handwriting trying to imitate them.
To study the art of calligraphy of philosophers of the past, Tosai collected their notes and handwriting trying to imitate them.
To study the art of calligraphy of philosophers of the past, Tosai collected their notes and handwriting trying to imitate them.

sen.j: 大坂に移り住んだ頃から書家として名声があがり、「唐様」の第一人者として人気を博し多くの門弟が集った。
sen.e: Around the time that Tosai moved to Osaka, he became celebrated as a calligrapher gaining popularity as the leading expert on 'karayo (Chinese style)'attracting numerous pupils.
Around the time that Tosai moved to Osaka, he became celebrated as a calligrapher gaining popularity as the leading expert on 'karayo (Chinese style)'attracting numerous pupils.
Around the time that Tosai moved to Osaka, he became celebrated as a calligrapher gaining popularity as the leading expert on 'karayo' (Chinese style) attracting numerous pupils.

sen.j: 頼春水、木村蒹葭堂、十時梅厓、伊勢国長島藩増山雪斎・森田士徳などが著名な文人がその門下となっている。
sen.e: Various distinguished writers including Shunsui RAI, Kenkado KIMURA, Baigai TOTOKI, Sessai as well as MASHIYAMA and Shitoku MORITA of the Nagashima Clan in Ise Province studied under Tosai.
Various distinguished writers including Shunsui RAI, Kenkado KIMURA, Baigai TOTOKI, Sessai as well as MASHIYAMA and Shitoku MORITA of the Nagashima Clan in Ise Province studied under Tosai.
Various distinguished writers including Shunsui RAI, Kenkado KIMURA, Baigai TOTOKI as well as Sessai MASHIYAMA and Shitoku MORITA of the Nagashima clan in Ise Province studied under Tosai.
sen.cmt: as well as を移動しました。

sen.j: 後年江戸の書家 市河米庵は陶斎の書には和習（和臭）がないとして第一の書家に掲げた。
sen.e: Beian ICHIKAWA, a calligrapher in the late Edo Period, mentioned Tosai as the best penman for the absence of Japanese-style influence (detectable Japaneseness) in his handwriting.
Beian ICHIKAWA, a calligrapher in the late Edo Period, mentioned Tosai as the best penman for the absence of Japanese-style influence (detectable Japaneseness) in his handwriting.
Beian ICHIKAWA, a calligrapher in the late Edo period, mentioned Tosai as the best penman for the absence of Japanese-style influence (detectable Japaneseness) in his handwriting.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 頼山陽も独立 (禅僧)・北島雪山と並べ上等の評価を与えている。
sen.e: Sanyo RAI also had a high opinion on Tosai as being comparable to Dokuryu (Zen priest) and Setsuzan KITAJIMA.
Sanyo RAI also had a high opinion on Tosai as being comparable to Dokuryu (Zen priest) and Setsuzan KITAJIMA.
Sanyo RAI also had a high opinion on Tosai as being comparable to Dokuryu (Zen priest) and Setsuzan KITAJIMA.

sen.j: 有職故実にも精しく、あたかも武士のような振る舞いだったという。
sen.e: Tosai was well-versed in Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) conducting himself as if he was a samurai.
Tosai was well-versed in Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) conducting himself as if he were a samurai.
Tosai was well-versed in Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) conducting himself as if he were a samurai.

sen.j: 奉行所や官吏を畏れず傲然とした態度を示したという。
sen.e: It is said that, unafraid of the magistrate's office or government officials, he remained undaunted towards them.
It is said that, unafraid of the magistrate's office or government officials, he remained undaunted towards them.
It is said that, unafraid of the magistrate's office or government officials, he remained undaunted towards them.

sen.j: 彦根藩に召されて屏風を描いたとき、潤筆料が支払われ絵師として扱われたことに憤慨して屏風を破って帰ってしまった。
sen.e: When called to the Hikone Domain to make drawings on a folding screen, offended by being treated as a painter for being paid a fee for is calligraphic works and paintings, Tosai tore the folding screen and left.

When called to the Hikone Domain to make drawings on a folding screen, offended by being treated as a painter for being paid a fee for is calligraphic works and paintings, Tosai tore the folding screen and left.

When called to the Hikone domain to make drawings on a folding screen, offended by being treated as a painter for being paid a fee for is calligraphic works and paintings, Tosai tore the folding screen and left.
sen.cmt: domain を小文字にしました。

sen.j: 弟子の森田士徳は師の陶斎を酒に酔わせ、金糸で飾り立てた軸を並べて師に揮毫させて、人気のある書を大量に手に入れていたという。
sen.e: It is said that Shitoku MORITA, one of Tosai's pupils, came into possession of a large quantity of popular calligraphy by getting his teacher Tosai drunk and making Tosai write on scrolls adorned with gold thread with brush.

It is said that Shitoku MORITA, one of Tosai's pupils, came into possession of a large quantity of popular calligraphy by getting his teacher Tosai drunk and making Tosai write on scrolls adorned with gold thread with a brush.

It is said that Shitoku MORITA, one of Tosai's pupils, came into possession of a large quantity of popular calligraphy by getting his teacher Tosai drunk and making Tosai write on scrolls adorned with gold thread with a brush.

sen.j: 中国語はほぼ母国語として会話することができた。
sen.e: Tosai was able to speak Chinese at virtually a native level.
Tosai was able to speak Chinese at virtually a native level.
Tosai was able to speak Chinese at virtually a native level.

sen.j: 仏門にあっても肉食し酒をこよなく愛した。
sen.e: Although being a priest, Tosai ate meat and had great love for sake.
Although being a priest, Tosai ate meat and had great love for sake.
Although being a priest, Tosai ate meat and had great love for sake.

sen.j: 筆まめで、随想集を多く遺している。
sen.e: Being a person of letters, Tosai left numerous essays.
Being a person of letters, Tosai left numerous essays.
Being a person of letters, Tosai left numerous essays.

sen.j: 『趙陶斎筆記』・『陶斎先生日記』など。
sen.e: Those essays include the Transcripts of Tosai CHO, Journal of Mr. Tosai and others.
Those essays include the Transcripts of Tosai CHO, Journal of Mr. Tosai and others.
Those essays include "Cho Tosai Hikki" (Transcripts of Tosai CHO), "Tosai sensei Nikki" (Journal of Mr. Tosai) and others.
sen.cmt: 書籍名を追加しました。

sen.j: 晩年は狷介さが目立った。
sen.e: In his old age, Tosai became noticeably stubborn and disagreeable.
In his old age, Tosai became noticeably stubborn and disagreeable.
In his old age, Tosai became noticeably stubborn and disagreeable.
